intro: Valeriana cassiensis, commonly known as the Congo valerian, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has dark green, opposite leaves and produces small, reddish-brown fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streambanks. Valeriana cassiensis is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional African medicine.
